conclusion: Determine the work done by the frictional force on the object as it is transported from point M to point N.
Calculate the frictional force using F_f = mu mg, resulting in F_f = 9 N.
Determine the acceleration of the object using a = F_f/m = mu g, resulting in a = 3 m/s^2.
Calculate the time taken for the object to reach the speed of the conveyor belt using t = v/a, resulting in t = 2 s.
Calculate the distance traveled by the object during the acceleration phase using d = 1/2 at^2, resulting in d = 6 m.
Determine the remaining distance traveled by the object after reaching the speed of the conveyor belt, resulting in 4 m.
Calculate the work done by the frictional force using W = F_f * d, resulting in W = 54 J.
The work done by the frictional force of the conveyor belt on the object as it is transported from point M to point N is 54 J.
